text: Salim Brüggemann. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Brüggemann S (2024). quappo: Unofficial Helper Functions around Quarto. R package version 0.0.9000, https://gitlab.com/rpkg.dev/quappo, https://quappo.rpkg.dev.
code: @Manual{,   title = {quappo: Unofficial Helper Functions around Quarto},   author = {Salim Brüggemann},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.9000, https://gitlab.com/rpkg.dev/quappo},   url = {https://quappo.rpkg.dev}, }

title: Unofficial Helper Functions around Quarto
text: Provides unofficial helper functions around quarto package, R interface Quarto CLI.

title: Unofficial Helper Functions around Quarto
text: install latest development version quappo, run following R:

title: Unofficial Helper Functions around Quarto
text: (function) reference found .

title: Unofficial Helper Functions around Quarto
text: package’s source code written R Markdown file format facilitate practices commonly referred literate programming. allows actual code freely mixed explanatory supplementary information expressive Markdown format instead rely # comments . .gen.R suffixed R source code found R/ generated respective R Markdown counterparts Rmd/ using pkgpurl::purl_rmd()1. Always make changes .Rmd files – never .R files – run pkgpurl::purl_rmd() regenerate R source files.

title: Unofficial Helper Functions around Quarto
text: package borrows lot Tidyverse design philosophies. R code adheres principles specified Tidyverse Design Guide wherever possible formatted according Tidyverse Style Guide (TSG) following exceptions: Line width limited 160 characters, double limit proposed TSG (80 characters ridiculously little given today’s high-resolution wide screen monitors). Furthermore, preferred style breaking long lines differs. Instead wrapping directly expression’s opening bracket suggested TSG, prefer two fewer line breaks indent subsequent lines within expression opening bracket: results less vertical horizontal spread code better readability pipes. Usage magrittr’s compound assignment pipe-operator %<>% desirable2. Usage R’s right-hand assignment operator -> allowed3. R source code split several files suggested TSG instead (far possible) kept single file Rmd/quappo.Rmd well-structured thanks Markdown support. far possible, deviations TSG plus additional restrictions formally specified pkgpurl::default_linters, (default) used pkgpurl::lint_rmd(), turn recommended way lint package.
code: # TSG proposes this do_something_very_complicated(   something = "that",   requires = many,   arguments = "some of which may be long" )  # we prefer this do_something_very_complicated(something = "that",                               requires = many,                               arguments = "some of which may be long")

what: Generate Quarto knitr code chunk snippets from structured data — chunks
title: Generate Quarto knitr code chunk snippets from structured data — chunks
text: Generates Quarto Markdown (.qmd) file snippets knitr figure table code chunks structured data.

title: Generate Quarto knitr code chunk snippets from structured data — chunks
Generate Quarto knitr code chunk snippets from structured data — chunks
text: data Input data returned read_chunk_toml(). dataframe column names correspond chunk options supported fig_chunk() tbl_chunk() plus optional iteration variable columns itr_vars itr_vars_r. Columns body, label fig_cap/tbl_cap mandatory. See section Input data details. env Environment evaluate iterations (see section Iteration variables details).

title: Generate Quarto knitr code chunk snippets from structured data — chunks
text: data, invisibly.

title: Generate Quarto knitr code chunk snippets from structured data — chunks
text: generated .qmd files intended included Quarto documents via built-include shortcode.

title: Generate Quarto knitr code chunk snippets from structured data — chunks
text: data columns type character cli::pluralize()d, meaning literal curly brackets ({ }) need escaped doubling ({{ }}). column names data can either correspond fig_chunk()/tbl_chunk()'s argument names (snake case), knitr's figure chunk option names (period-separared) directly Quarto's figure/table code chunk option names (kebab case) – converted needed. Additional column names silently ignored, except optional iteration variable columns itr_vars (type list) itr_vars_r (type character).

title: Generate Quarto knitr code chunk snippets from structured data — chunks
text: Specifying iteration variables allows produce multiple code chunks per data row. iteration variables can referred columns via cli::pluralize()'s string interpolation syntax (.e. R code curly brackets). itr_vars column must list named lists (NULL iteration respective rows). itr_vars_r column allows specify itr_vars string R code (must yield list named lists / NULLs parsed executed).

title: Generate Quarto knitr code chunk snippets from structured data — chunks
code: # data row without iterations tibble::tibble(label = "fig-cars",                fig_cap = "Today's ({clock::date_today(zone = Sys.timezone())}) top figure",                fig_column = "page",                fig_height = 8L,                body = "plot(cars)") |>   quappo::chunks() #> $`fig-cars` #> ```{r} #> #| label: fig-cars #> #| fig-cap: #> #|   - Today's (2024-12-15) top figure #> #| fig-column: page #> #| fig-height: 8 #> #| fig-pos: H #>  #> plot(cars) #> ``` #>  #>   # data row with iteration variables specified directly as `itr_vars` tibble::tibble(itr_vars = list(list(v = "cyl"),                                list(v = "disp"),                                list(v = "hp")),                label = "fig-mpg-by-{v}",                fig_cap = "Motor Trend Car Road Tests: mpg per {v}",                fig_column = "screen",                fig_height = 8L,                body = "plot(x = mtcars$mpg, y = mtcars${v})") |>   quappo::chunks() #> $`fig-mpg-by-cyl` #> ```{r} #> #| label: fig-mpg-by-cyl #> #| fig-cap: #> #|   - Motor Trend Car Road Tests: mpg per cyl #> #| fig-column: screen #> #| fig-height: 8 #> #| fig-pos: H #>  #> plot(x = mtcars$mpg, y = mtcars$cyl) #> ``` #>  #>  #> $`fig-mpg-by-disp` #> ```{r} #> #| label: fig-mpg-by-disp #> #| fig-cap: #> #|   - Motor Trend Car Road Tests: mpg per disp #> #| fig-column: screen #> #| fig-height: 8 #> #| fig-pos: H #>  #> plot(x = mtcars$mpg, y = mtcars$disp) #> ``` #>  #>  #> $`fig-mpg-by-hp` #> ```{r} #> #| label: fig-mpg-by-hp #> #| fig-cap: #> #|   - Motor Trend Car Road Tests: mpg per hp #> #| fig-column: screen #> #| fig-height: 8 #> #| fig-pos: H #>  #> plot(x = mtcars$mpg, y = mtcars$hp) #> ``` #>  #>   # data row with iteration variables specified indirectly as `itr_vars_r` code tibble::tibble(itr_vars_r = "purrr::map(colnames(mtcars)[5:7], \\(x) list(v = x))",                label = "fig-mpg-by-{v}",                fig_cap = "Motor Trend Car Road Tests: mpg per {v}",                fig_column = "screen",                fig_height = 8L,                body = "plot(x = mtcars$mpg, y = mtcars${v})") |>   quappo::chunks() #> $`fig-mpg-by-drat` #> ```{r} #> #| label: fig-mpg-by-drat #> #| fig-cap: #> #|   - Motor Trend Car Road Tests: mpg per drat #> #| fig-column: screen #> #| fig-height: 8 #> #| fig-pos: H #>  #> plot(x = mtcars$mpg, y = mtcars$drat) #> ``` #>  #>  #> $`fig-mpg-by-wt` #> ```{r} #> #| label: fig-mpg-by-wt #> #| fig-cap: #> #|   - Motor Trend Car Road Tests: mpg per wt #> #| fig-column: screen #> #| fig-height: 8 #> #| fig-pos: H #>  #> plot(x = mtcars$mpg, y = mtcars$wt) #> ``` #>  #>  #> $`fig-mpg-by-qsec` #> ```{r} #> #| label: fig-mpg-by-qsec #> #| fig-cap: #> #|   - Motor Trend Car Road Tests: mpg per qsec #> #| fig-column: screen #> #| fig-height: 8 #> #| fig-pos: H #>  #> plot(x = mtcars$mpg, y = mtcars$qsec) #> ``` #>  #>

title: Collapse Quarto authors — collapse_authors
text: Collapses author names Quarto project document single string.

title: Collapse Quarto authors — collapse_authors
code: collapse_authors(   config = quarto::quarto_inspect()$config,   reverse_first = TRUE,   orcid_style = c("none", "icon", "plain"),   orcid_icon = fontawesome::fa(name = "orcid"),   sep = ", ",   sep2 = " and ",   last = ", and " )

title: Collapse Quarto authors — collapse_authors
text: config Quarto configuration returned quarto::quarto_inspect()$config. reverse_first Whether reverse first last name first author, meaning Jane Doe becomes Doe, Jane. orcid_style include authors' ORCIDs output. One "none" omit ORCIDs output. "icon" include ORCID icon (specified via orcid_icon) author name links respective author's ORCID page. Suitable HTML output. "plain" simply include ORCID plain text parentheses author name. orcid_icon SVG icon used orcid_style = "icon". sep Separator. character string. sep2 Separator special case x contains two elements. character string. last Last separator, truncation. E.g. use ", " serial comma. character string.

title: Collapse Quarto authors — collapse_authors
text: character scalar.

what: Get active Quarto project profile(s) — cur_profiles
title: Get active Quarto project profile(s) — cur_profiles
text: Returns currently active Quarto project profile(s). Wrapper around Sys.getenv("QUARTO_PROFILE") returns NULL Quarto rendering.

title: Get active Quarto project profile(s) — cur_profiles
Get active Quarto project profile(s) — cur_profiles
text: NULL Quarto rendering Quarto project profiles active, otherwise character vector.

title: Get active Quarto project profile(s) — cur_profiles

what: Get default Quarto project profile(s) — default_profiles
title: Get default Quarto project profile(s) — default_profiles
text: Returns Quarto project's default profile(s).

title: Get default Quarto project profile(s) — default_profiles
Get default Quarto project profile(s) — default_profiles
text: input Path Quarto project directory. character scalar.

title: Get default Quarto project profile(s) — default_profiles
text: NULL default Quarto project profiles configured, otherwise character vector.

title: Get default Quarto project profile(s) — default_profiles

what: Assemble Quarto knitr figure chunk — fig_chunk
title: Assemble Quarto knitr figure chunk — fig_chunk
text: Assembles Quarto knitr figure chunk.

title: Assemble Quarto knitr figure chunk — fig_chunk
code: fig_chunk(   body,   label,   fig_cap = NULL,   fig_subcap = NULL,   fig_cap_location = NULL,   fig_column = NULL,   fig_width = NULL,   fig_height = NULL,   fig_pos = "H",   fig_link = NULL,   column = NULL,   layout_ncol = NULL,   layout_nrow = NULL,   layout = NULL,   out_width = NULL,   out_height = NULL )

title: Assemble Quarto knitr figure chunk — fig_chunk
text: body R code insert code chunk's body. character scalar. label Unique code chunk label. Set Quarto's label code chunk option. character scalar starts "fig-" contains letters, numbers, underscores (_) dashes (-). fig_cap Figure caption. Set Quarto's fig-cap code chunk option. Either NULL omit character vector. fig_subcap Figure subcaptions. Set Quarto's fig-subcap code chunk option. Either NULL omit character vector. fig_cap_location Location place figure captions. Set Quarto's fig-cap-location code chunk option. Either NULL omit one "top", "bottom" "margin". fig_column Quarto article layout class figure output. Set Quarto's fig-column code chunk option. Either NULL omit one "body" "body-outset" "body-outset-left" "body-outset-right" "page" "page-left" "page-right" "page-inset" "page-inset-left" "page-inset-right" "screen" "screen-left" "screen-right" "screen-inset" "screen-inset-shaded" "screen-inset-left" "screen-inset-right" "margin" fig_width Width plot (inches), used graphics device. Set Quarto's fig-width code chunk option. Either NULL omit numeric scalar. fig_height Height plot (inches), used graphics device. Set Quarto's fig-height code chunk option. Either NULL omit numeric scalar. fig_pos LaTeX figure position arrangement used \begin{figure}[]. Set Quarto's fig-pos code chunk option. Either NULL omit, character scalar, FALSE figure position specifier, sometimes necessary custom figure environments (sidewaysfigure). fig_link Hyperlink target figure. Set Quarto's fig-link code chunk option. Either NULL omit character scalar. column Quarto article layout class code chunk's output. Set Quarto's column code chunk option. Either NULL omit one "body" "body-outset" "body-outset-left" "body-outset-right" "page" "page-left" "page-right" "page-inset" "page-inset-left" "page-inset-right" "screen" "screen-left" "screen-right" "screen-inset" "screen-inset-shaded" "screen-inset-left" "screen-inset-right" "margin" layout_ncol Number columns arrange chunk output . Set Quarto's layout-ncol code chunk option. Either NULL omit positive integerish number. layout_nrow Number rows arrange chunk output . Set Quarto's layout-nrow code chunk option. Either NULL omit positive integerish number. layout Custom layout proportions. Set Quarto's layout code chunk option. list numeric vectors vector defines column proportions row. Note numbers row arbitrary don’t need add particular total. out_width Width plot output document, can different physical fig_width, .e., plots can scaled output document. Set Quarto's -width code chunk option. Either NULL omit character scalar. out_height Height plot output document, can different physical fig_height, .e., plots can scaled output document. Set Quarto's -height code chunk option. Either NULL omit character scalar.

title: Assemble Quarto knitr figure chunk — fig_chunk
text: character scalar.

title: Assemble Quarto knitr figure chunk — fig_chunk

title: Render Quarto book partly — render_partly
text: Renders file ("chapter") subdirectory ("part") Quarto book project specified profile. Convenience wrapper around quarto::quarto_render(), default renders file currently active RStudio. Note function useful output_format = "pdf" Quarto can build whole PDF , individual pages , hence partial rendering possible.

title: Render Quarto book partly — render_partly
code: render_partly(   path = rstudioapi::getActiveDocumentContext()$path,   profile = default_profiles(),   output_format = "html",   execute = TRUE,   execute_daemon_restart = FALSE,   execute_debug = FALSE,   use_freezer = FALSE,   cache_refresh = FALSE,   debug = FALSE,   quiet = FALSE,   pandoc_args = NULL,   as_job = getOption("quarto.render_as_job", default = interactive() &&     rstudioapi::isAvailable()) )

title: Render Quarto book partly — render_partly
text: path Path file ("chapter") subdirectory ("part") Quarto book project. profile Quarto project profile(s) use. Either character vector profile names NULL use default profile. output_format Target output format (defaults "html"). option "" render formats defined within file project. execute Whether execute embedded code chunks. execute_daemon_restart Restart keepalive Jupyter kernel render. Note option applicable rendering Jupyter notebooks Jupyter markdown. execute_debug Show debug output Jupyter kernel. use_freezer Force use frozen computations incremental file render. cache_refresh Force refresh execution cache. debug Leave intermediate files place render. quiet Suppress warning messages. pandoc_args Additional command line arguments pass Pandoc. as_job Render RStudio background job. Default "auto", render individual documents normally projects background jobs. Use quarto.render_as_job R option control default globally.

title: Render Quarto book partly — render_partly
text: path, invisibly.

title: Render Quarto book partly — render_partly
text: function registered RStudio add-, allowing RStudio users assign custom shortcut invoke command palette. Note default path = rstudioapi::getActiveDocumentContext()$path work called via keyboard shortcut, called command palette. command palette steals focus consequence document underneath considered currently active anymore long command palette opened.

title: Render Quarto book partly — render_partly

what: Assemble Quarto knitr table chunk — tbl_chunk
title: Assemble Quarto knitr table chunk — tbl_chunk
text: Assembles Quarto knitr table chunk.

title: Assemble Quarto knitr table chunk — tbl_chunk
code: tbl_chunk(   body,   label,   tbl_cap,   tbl_subcap = NULL,   tbl_cap_location = NULL,   tbl_colwidths = NULL,   tbl_column = NULL,   column = NULL,   layout_ncol = NULL,   layout_nrow = NULL,   layout = NULL )

title: Assemble Quarto knitr table chunk — tbl_chunk
text: body R code insert code chunk's body. character scalar. label Unique code chunk label. Set Quarto's label code chunk option. character scalar starts "tbl-" contains letters, numbers, underscores (_) dashes (-). tbl_cap Table caption. Set Quarto's tbl-cap code chunk option. Either NULL omit character vector. tbl_subcap Table subcaptions. Set Quarto's tbl-subcap code chunk option. Either NULL omit character vector. tbl_cap_location Location place table captions. Set Quarto's tbl-cap-location code chunk option. Either NULL omit one "top", "bottom" "margin". tbl_colwidths Apply explicit table column widths Markdown grid tables pipe tables columns characters wide (72 default). formats (e.g. HTML) excellent job automatically sizing table columns don’t benefit much column width specifications. formats (e.g. LaTeX) require table column sizes order correctly flow longer cell content (major reason tables > 72 columns wide assigned explicit widths Pandoc). can specified : "auto": Apply Markdown table column widths except hyperlink table (tends throw automatic calculation column widths based Markdown text width cells). "auto" default HTML output formats. "true": Always apply Markdown table widths. "true" default non-HTML formats. "false": Never apply Markdown table widths. numeric vector (e.g. c(40, 30, 30)): Array explicit width percentages. NULL omit tbl-colwidths chunk option. tbl_column Quarto article layout class figure output. Set Quarto's tbl-column code chunk option. Either NULL omit one "body" "body-outset" "body-outset-left" "body-outset-right" "page" "page-left" "page-right" "page-inset" "page-inset-left" "page-inset-right" "screen" "screen-left" "screen-right" "screen-inset" "screen-inset-shaded" "screen-inset-left" "screen-inset-right" "margin" column Quarto article layout class code chunk's output. Set Quarto's column code chunk option. Either NULL omit one "body" "body-outset" "body-outset-left" "body-outset-right" "page" "page-left" "page-right" "page-inset" "page-inset-left" "page-inset-right" "screen" "screen-left" "screen-right" "screen-inset" "screen-inset-shaded" "screen-inset-left" "screen-inset-right" "margin" layout_ncol Number columns arrange chunk output . Set Quarto's layout-ncol code chunk option. Either NULL omit positive integerish number. layout_nrow Number rows arrange chunk output . Set Quarto's layout-nrow code chunk option. Either NULL omit positive integerish number. layout Custom layout proportions. Set Quarto's layout code chunk option. list numeric vectors vector defines column proportions row. Note numbers row arbitrary don’t need add particular total.

title: Assemble Quarto knitr table chunk — tbl_chunk
text: character scalar.

code: quappo::tbl_chunk(body = "knitr::kable(head(cars))",                   label = "tbl-head-cars",                   tbl_cap = "Head of dataset `cars`",                   tbl_column = "margin") #> ```{r} #> #| label: tbl-head-cars #> #| tbl-cap: #> #|   - Head of dataset `cars` #> #| tbl-column: margin #>  #> knitr::kable(head(cars)) #> ``` #>

title: View Quarto output — view_output
text: Opens Quarto project's pre-rendered output specified format RStudio viewer pane system's default application. "html", local HTTP server launched serves HTML output 127.0.0.1:3456 default. considerably faster responsive quarto::quarto_preview() (runs Quarto background automatically reloads browser input files document resources (e.g. CSS) change).

title: View Quarto output — view_output
code: view_output(   input = ".",   output_format = "html",   profile = NULL,   host = "127.0.0.1",   port = 3456L,   in_rstudio_viewer = interactive() )

title: View Quarto output — view_output
text: input Path Quarto project directory. character scalar. output_format Quarto output format open. "html", local HTTP server launched serving projects's HTML output host specified port. profile Quarto project profile(s) use. Either character vector profile names NULL use default profile. host IPv4 address serve HTML output . character scalar. relevant format = "html". port TCP port number serve HTML output . integer scalar. Note Unix-like systems including Linux macOS, port numbers 1024 require root privileges. specified port already occupied, randomly chosen port 1025–49151 used instead. relevant format = "html". in_rstudio_viewer Whether open output file RStudio viewer pane possible, .e. RStudio available. FALSE RStudio unavailable, output file opened system's default application output_format via xopen::xopen() instead. Note PDFs within R session temporary directory can opened RStudio's viewer pane, others automatically passed system's default PDF viewer.

title: View Quarto output — view_output
text: format = "html", httpuv::WebServer object. format = "pdf", path PDF file. Invisibly cases.

title: View Quarto output — view_output
text: Note web server started view_output() continue running background explicitly stopped (e.g. via httpuv::stopServer() httpuv::stopAllServers()) R session terminated. already running web server port reused possible (.e. launched R session), otherwise port within range 1024–49151 ("user" "registered" ports) randomly chosen using httpuv::randomPort().

title: View Quarto output — view_output
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # start server s <- quappo::view_output()  # stop server s$stop()} # }
